newsitem.title: USA: Broderbund to buy 50 pct of Living Books.
newsitem.headline: Broderbund to buy 50 pct of Living Books.

text.p: Broderbund Software Inc on Friday said it has reached a preliminary agreement to acquire book publisher Random House Inc's 50 percent stake in the companies' partnership called Living Books.

Living Books develops educational software on CD-ROMs, many of which are based on Random House books. Popular titles include "Just Grandma and Me", Dr. Seuss's "ABC" and "Green Eggs and Ham", and "The Berenstain Bears Get in a Fight".
Financial terms of the deal were undisclosed.
Broderbund shares were off 7/8 at 33-5/8 by mid-afternoon.
In a statement, the two companies said Random House would continue to contribute content for Living Books and distribute Living Books to U.S. bookstores.
The two companies originally entered into their 50/50 Living Books partnership in 1994.
